title: Web Developer - FIFA Ultimate Team Companion App
bullet_points: Modify and peer review front-end templates using JS/LESS for the FUT Companion App to reduce bugs and enhance user experience
Cooperate with fellow software developers to review and act on issues found in the Companion App's data pipeline via Python, Java, and NAnt
Participate in weekly developer roundtables to evaluate existing and potential future workflow or product issues
Continue to update, escalate, and close user stories through the team's 2-year sprints

title: Associate Technical Artist
bullet_points: Coordinated with the Rigging team on the creation, deployment, and continued support of Maya plugins and other software packages used by artists
Leveraged AGILE principles in the planning and development of internal rigging software to automate tedious tasks including mass mesh weight transfers through the C# Maya API
Supported artists on the game teams with visual bugs and glitches visible on various assets and animations using Frostbite schematics and Frostbite timeline

title: Test Automation Engineer Co-op
bullet_points: Discussed, planned, and executed the creation of a web front-end with python Bottle, HTML/CSS, and Javascript to dramatically decrease the setup time in regression testing for server features
Responded to development team's requests for more thorough build e-mails with a tool written using python's lxml and etree libraries, allowing teams to find failing tests tied to closed JIRA issues
Met with teammates to sync up on progress and plan out future steps for automation
Managed Ubuntu and OEL5.8 VMs used as build machines and test environments

title: Software Developer Co-op
bullet_points: Oversaw deployment and repeated testing of BES10 servers through Jenkins, Maven, Ant, and VMWare vSphere

Created, deployed, and re-tooled various scripts used for generating large amounts of XML, preparing files in the build pipeline for new servers, and managing VM snapshots for the production BES testing environment

Maintained and raised new Windows Server 2008 R2 and Ubuntu 12.04 machines to be used as test environments and build slaves for the Continuous Integration Team, as well as testers in the Mississauga and Seattle teams
Investigated, installed and reviewed various third-party plugins for Jenkins with a pilot instance before finalizing them on the CI team's production server
